name: Adventure Time: Finn and Jake's Epic Quest
description: Team up as Finn and Jake in a 3D adventure of epic proportions! The Land of Ooo has been transformed into a giant video game, and BMO has been kidnapped. Brawl your way through the Witch's garden, Ice Kingdom, Fire Kingdom, and even the Land of the Dead itself to rescue BMO and uncover the evil mastermind!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, or Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo or Amd Athlon X2 Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GT240 / ATI RAdeon 4850 Storage: 5 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Epic Quest is  extremely  reminiscent of ToeJam & Earl. Not a bad thing  at all .  Performance is good, controls are tight and has support for 1440p+/120hz/60fps+.  Voiceover work has been done by the original cast. Plenty of new lines have been voiced which tie into the 'video game' world very well which is important. Most of your favourite characters from the series make appearances, both the friends and foes. Set across the different worlds each containing at least 5 levels, you will come across a bunch of familiar collectables while following your main 'quest' to obtain the relics.   Upbeat chiptune 8/16bit styled soundtrack. Not only fits the theme but is rather catchy too.  Great game for the price and fans of the series.  Easily recommended from what i've played. :)
Unlike the show, this game is far from perfect. But it's ok...

The game's a nice little mix of Toe Jam & Earl and Action RPGs like Diablo, with some very (very!) light RPG elements. You go through maze-like levels, collect stuff and use some ridiculous power ups. The graphics are not amazing, but capture the charm of Adventure Time well. So does the voice acting (all of the original voice actors are here!).  It does get repetitive after a while, but the game is short and sweet, and it's hella cheap. Easy recommentdation for Adventure Time fans!

The Key Guy said 'Billy will be hiding in most levels. He will be rather hard to find.' Billy was standing 5 feet away. That's some intense hide and seek skills.  10/10 would play hide and seek again  Now onto the actual review... This game is amazing. It has literally won a spot in the selection of my favorite games. It's a simple 'beat 'em up' kind of game, with fun spells, enemies, and courses. The music is cute and catchy, and the stages can be repetitive, but there's always some kind of a twist. This game is worth buying, and isn't a waste! My only regret is that it wasn't longer.

At the moment I do not recommend the game. There are several game-breaking bugs; such as killing the forest witch when she sits on Finn or Jake - your camera zooms in all the way and all weapons except scrolls are useless.  After the update I lost all my save data; I was already at the Ice King.   Another problem is the weird control scheme. It uses the arrow keys instead of WASD and it kinda catches you off-guard.  I also felt that there was a lot of hit and miss moments in this game, from the cutscenes being either poorly rigged mouth movements to just being a zoom in on the low resolution screenshot from the actual cartoon series.   I do appeal to the original voice cast, and many references to previous episodes. However a pet peeve of mine is the world isn't open. Easily you could have just mashed all levels onto one big slate, as the grounds already look like puzzle pieces or maybe used a wall or forest like boundary instead of have the entire land of Ooo floating on the sky abyss.
Best looking adventure time game out but it's lacking in story and level design.

I 100% this game, in 7.6 hours, on hard difficulty. All achievements as well.  Pros: - Voiced by the original cast. - 28 levels in total. - Levels are GIANT. - Controls are tight.  Cons: - You get lost VERY easilly. - Combat is repetitive. - Some of the spells are WAY TO OVERPOWERED. - The 'Puppies!' achievement is bugged, wrong image. - Re-using the same enemies in different worlds, even though they don't fit in. E.G 'Forest Witch' in the Fire Kingdom.  I would rate this game 5/10, playable, but flawed.

Its not the worst game of this type; y'know, the kind that sells off the success of the brand. There's plenty of references to the show, at least, and they are integrated with moderate success through the decision to make them affect gameplay rather than just be a collectibale on the side. The mechanics are, for the most part, bad. A fairly simple combat system with lots of walking in-between. Would have benefitted greatly from a more comprehensive map possibly accessible from the pause menu. All the collecting is meaningless; money and silver keys only get you enchiridion pages which are already in abundance and the combat is, again, so simple that the pages aren't really all that useful. There's been a lot of fuss over how much support the devs have shown after release. Well, cool your boots; its been like four days since release and, frankly, the game is so riddled with bugs it shouldn't have been released so prematurely. This is all the more embarrassing when you consider its a re-release of an, otherwise, free game.  All in all, the reasonable pricetag makes up for a lot of its shortcomings, and, for the fans, being able to interact with the Adventure Time universe outside of the show is great. But, ultimately, its not as good as the show, or other videogames, so maybe consider investing your time in those instead.
If you like Toejam & Earl, you'll love this game. I'm not an Adventure Time fan personally, but I got a kick out of this game regardless.  I'd say go play it. Now.

Like other people have already stated, this game is a mix between toejam & earl and diablo-lite. Being a HUGE toejam & earl fan from age 7, this game was a must buy for me and I'm not in the least bit disapointed. Gameplay is faster paced than toejam & earl and instead of mainly avoiding enemies like in tj&e, your fighting them. A very lite level up/upgrade system is also included. This game is a instant purchase for fans of tj&e. This game gives you a hint of what tj&e 3 should have been or what tj&e 4 needs to be if we ever get that. The only complaint is lack of MP, which will hopefully be added down the road, but if not I'll still be having a blast with F&J's Epic Quest.
This game is a shorter version of the free version on Cartoon Network's website. This has 4 main worlds while the website version has 7.
Can be fun but a bit repeditive.
meh got boring and repetitive pretty quickly
its aight
Best game i've played in a long time!

It's kind of samey.  There's a degree of difficulty in the sense that you need to complete a level if you die even by environment you need to redo the whole level.  It's okay, for $10 or even cheaper if it's on sale. I wouldn't pay more though.
its a scam when i open the came it works untill it gos to the map then it just gos black

So far this game is fun, and has a good storyline. Help find beemo, and his artifacts to free him. And kill some baddies on the way. But I do have some problems with the game mechanics. The movemet is very unpolished and just downright jerky. Rolling even stops movement for about half a second after you complete the roll. I think this game would be a lot more enjoyable if the physics and mechanics for movement and combat were more polished and actually felt complete unlike how they are now, as of now it feels like an alpha stage product. Very unpolished 5/10
ADDDDVEEENNNNTTUUUURREEEE TIIEEEEMMMMMMM ~~~~~~~~!!!!  It's a nice goof off game.
controls aren't good and the whole game is misleading, how can i get a refund?
As a adventure time fan. I like it, but it is free on the cartoon network website.
this game reminds me of a loving callback to Toejam & Earl in the best way possible. had a lot of fun playing this game!

I am a huge fan of Adventure Time, so I was naturally excited for an AT game! Well.... the combat is clunky, and the game is a little slow paced... Its ok. If you really love AT then check it out. Just wait for it to go on sale.

If you ever had a Sega Genesis and had the good fortune to play Toe Jam & Earl, it's almost the exact same game but wonderfully set in the Land Of Ooo.  I loved TJ&E, and this game will plague me like a time vampire while I enjoy every second.
Basic and hack and smash, gets kinda old but for how cheap it is what did I expect? same ♥♥♥♥ different level over and over.

I'm a big fan of the show and even I couldn't enjoy this game. It is truely a bad game designed to cash in on Adventure Time fans based on the name alone. Sadly it worked on me. Don't buy this game. Rather go and watch the show instead.

The Good: Easy and fun combat, good music, graphical style fits well.  The Bad: Short (5 hours to complete the game), a bit repetitive, lack of secondary voice acting cast (No Ice King, Flame King, Death, etc)  The Bottom Line: If you're not expecting hours upon hours of gameplay and are an avid fan of the show, Epic Quest may very well be for you. The 12 achievements are also easily completed within a few hours time, making it an easy '100% completion' game.
AWESOME!!!! One thing I don't like is when you die you have to go back a level. Out of 10 I would give this a 8!   8/10
